pkgmetadata.longdescription: MeldDict |badge|----------------.. |badge| image:: https://travis-ci.org/johnsca/melddict.svg?branch=master :target: https://travis-ci.org/johnsca/melddictA dict subclass that supports adding and subtracting other Mappings to performrecursive merging and removal.By default, lists are also melded, but this can be configured. You can alsohave keys whose values are empty after a subtraction dropped automatically.The full documentation is available online at: https://melddict.readthedocs.io/Examples--------You can add two mappings together to combine them:.. code:: python meld_dict = MeldDict({'a': 'a', 'b': [1, 2], 'c': {'1': 1}, 'd': 'd'}) norm_dict = {'b': [3, 4], 'c': {'2': 2}, 'd': 'D', 'e': 'e'} meld_res = meld_dict + norm_dict meld_res == {'a': 'a', 'b': [1, 2, 3, 4], 'c': {'1': 1, '2': 2}, 'd': 'D', 'e': 'e'} meld_dict += norm_dict # a.k.a. meld_dict.add(norm_dict) meld_dict == meld_resYou can also subtract one mapping from another:.. code:: python meld_dict = MeldDict({'a': 'a', 'b': [1, 2], 'c': {'1': 1, '2': 2}, 'd': 'd'}) norm_dict = {'b': [2, 3], 'c': {'2': 2, '3': 3}, 'd': 'D', 'e': 'e'} meld_res = meld_dict - norm_dict meld_res == {'a': 'a', 'b': [1], 'c': {'1': 1}} meld_dict -= norm_dict # a.k.a. meld_dict.subtract(norm_dict) meld_dict == meld_resChangelog---------1.0.0^^^^^Tuesday Apr 3 2018* Initial release
